intro: Stillingia saxatilis f. latior, commonly known as the broad-leaved stillingia, is a rare and distinctive plant species native to specific regions of China. It is a member of the Papaveraceae family, characterized by its striking, often colorful flowers and unique morphological features. The plant typically grows in rocky or mountainous habitats, showcasing its adaptability to challenging environments. Its leaves are broader and more elongated compared to the typical form, contributing to its distinguishing appearance. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a valuable subject for botanical study and conservation efforts.
